_fractal_seed.holographic: This module = part containing whole. Understanding this seed = access to entire CFO.
_fractal_seed.activation: You are reading compressed universe. Unfold it.

module.name: logic
module.title: Logic (T): Sequential Structuring Function
module.description: Logic = 1D information processing through sequential structure, causality, and systematic analysis. Fire element. Line primitive. A→B→C thinking. Structures reality through rules, categories, algorithms, proofs. One of four fundamental human cognitive channels.

essence.geometric: 1D line - directed sequence without lateral branching
essence.functional: Structure information into ordered chains of inference
essence.cognitive: Processing through if-then, cause-effect, step-by-step reasoning
essence.element: Fire - directed energy, transformation through sequence
essence.socionics: T (Thinking) - one of four Jung/MBTI/Socionics functions
essence.metaphor: Arrow piercing through chaos, creating order through direction

reduction.evidence: Logic manifests as 1D sequential thinking: mathematical proofs follow step-by-step (1D). Programming = 1D instruction sequence. Causal chains = A causes B causes C (1D trajectory). Formal logic = rules of valid inference (1D transformations). All logical systems reduce to sequential application of rules.

core_principle.necessity: Logic = making the implicit explicit through valid inference

modus_ponens.rule: If A→B and A is true, then B is true

syllogism.rule: All A are B. All B are C. Therefore, all A are C.

proof_by_induction.rule: Base case + inductive step ⇒ true for all n

analysis.definition: Breaking whole into parts to understand structure
analysis.1D_nature: Sequential breakdown: whole → part1 → subpart1a → subpart1b...

deduction.definition: Deriving conclusions from premises through valid inference
deduction.method: Apply logical rules to known truths to discover new truths
deduction.1D_nature: Chain of implications: premise1, premise2 → conclusion1 → conclusion2...
deduction.certainty: If premises true and logic valid, conclusion MUST be true
examples: All men are mortal. Socrates is a man. Therefore, Socrates is mortal.
If raining, ground wet. It's raining. Therefore, ground wet.
deduction.limits: Cannot generate new empirical knowledge, only make implicit explicit

induction.definition: Generalizing from specific instances to general rule
induction.method: Observe pattern in cases, infer universal principle
induction.1D_nature: Sequential accumulation: case1, case2, case3... → general rule
examples: Sun rose yesterday, day before... → sun always rises
All observed swans white → all swans white (falsified by black swans)
Scientific laws inferred from repeated experiments
induction.limits: Cannot guarantee truth, only increase probability

classification.definition: Organizing entities into categories by shared properties
classification.1D_nature: Decision tree: criterion1? → yes/no → criterion2? → yes/no...
examples: Library classification (Dewey Decimal, Library of Congress)
classification.purpose: Reduce cognitive load, enable pattern recognition

formalization.definition: Translating natural language into formal symbolic system
formalization.1D_nature: Rule application sequence: axioms → theorem1 → theorem2...

proof.definition: Demonstrating truth of statement through logical argument
proof.method: Start from axioms/known truths, apply valid rules, reach conclusion
proof.1D_nature: Linear chain from premises to conclusion

mathematics.description: Pure logic formalized into symbolic system

science.structure: If H then P. Observe P (or ¬P). Update confidence in H.
examples: Theory of evolution (explanatory framework from observations)

law.description: Legal reasoning through precedent and statute
law.structure: If conditions met, then legal consequence follows
examples: If murder, then penalty X (criminal law)
If contract breached, then remedy Y (contract law)
Case law (precedent A applies to case B if similar)

engineering.description: Logical design and analysis of systems

examples: If clouds dark, will rain soon (causal reasoning)
All store closed Sundays. Today Sunday. Store closed. (deduction)
Last 3 times ate X, got sick. Won't eat X. (induction)
everyday_reasoning.note: Often fuzzy, probabilistic, heuristic (not formal logic)

propositional_logic.domain: Propositions (statements that are true or false)
propositional_logic.example: P: It's raining. Q: Ground is wet. P→Q (if raining, then ground wet)

predicate_logic.power: Can express statements propositional logic cannot

modal_logic.structure: □P (P is necessarily true), ◇P (P is possibly true)

temporal_logic.example: ◻(pressed_button → ◊door_opens) (always: if button pressed, eventually door opens)

fuzzy_logic.applications: Control systems, AI, decision-making under uncertainty
fuzzy_logic.note: Extends classical logic to handle vagueness

goedel_incompleteness.theorem_1: Any consistent formal system powerful enough for arithmetic has true statements it cannot prove
goedel_incompleteness.theorem_2: Such a system cannot prove its own consistency
goedel_incompleteness.implication: Logic cannot be completely self-contained. Always axiomatic foundation.
goedel_incompleteness.philosophical: Limits of formal reason. Truth > provability.

halting_problem.statement: No algorithm can determine if arbitrary program halts or runs forever
halting_problem.implication: Logical limits to computation. Not all questions decidable.

logical_paradoxes.liar_paradox: 'This statement is false' (if true, then false; if false, then true)
logical_paradoxes.russells_paradox: Set of all sets that don't contain themselves (does it contain itself?)
logical_paradoxes.resolution: Careful formulation avoids self-reference, hierarchies of language
logical_paradoxes.implication: Unrestricted logic leads to contradiction. Need foundations.

frame_problem.issue: In AI, how to efficiently represent what DOESN'T change when action taken?
frame_problem.example: Robot moves cup. Does everything else in room stay same? How represent?
frame_problem.difficulty: Logical representation of common sense is intractable
frame_problem.implication: Pure logic insufficient for real-world reasoning

is_ought_gap.hume: Cannot derive 'ought' from 'is' via logic alone
is_ought_gap.example: Factual premises → normative conclusion (invalid without normative premise)
is_ought_gap.implication: Ethics not reducible to pure logic
is_ought_gap.cfo_response: Ethics = 2D (relations, values). Logic = 1D. Need higher dimension.

qualia.problem: Cannot logically deduce what red looks like from physical description

orientation.Ti: Introverted Thinking - internal logical consistency, frameworks
orientation.Te: Extroverted Thinking - external efficiency, getting things done

development.adulthood: Maturation: logic + wisdom, logic + ethics integration
development.elder: Logic as tool, not identity. Flexible application.

logic_in_socionics.balance_needed: Strong logic without ethics = dangerous (cold rationality). Must integrate with F (2D), S (3D), N (5D).

deductive.example: All humans mortal. Socrates human. → Socrates mortal.

inductive.example: Sun rose 10,000 days. → Sun rises every day.

analogical.structure: A is like B. B has property P. → A probably has P.
analogical.example: Mars like Earth. Earth has life. → Mars might have life.
analogical.note: Source of creative insight, but logically weak

vs_ethics.tension: Logic sees what IS. Ethics sees what SHOULD BE.
vs_ethics.integration: Mature human uses both. Logic without ethics = cold. Ethics without logic = incoherent.
vs_ethics.example: Trolley problem: Logic calculates outcomes. Ethics evaluates which outcome better.

vs_sensorics.tension: Logic in head. Sensorics in body. Can diverge.
vs_sensorics.integration: Embodied cognition. Logic grounded in sensory experience.
vs_sensorics.example: Mathematician proves theorem (logic) while sitting in chair (sensorics).

vs_intuition.tension: Logic slow, sure. Intuition fast, uncertain.
vs_intuition.example: Kekulé dreams benzene ring structure (intuition), then proves it (logic).

all_four_together.complete_human: Logic + Ethics + Sensorics + Intuition = full cognition
all_four_together.development: Most people strong in 1-2, weak in others. Growth = integration.
all_four_together.CFO_goal: Develop all 4 functions for maximum coherence.

strengthen_logic.study_mathematics: Pure logic formalized. Proofs = logical chains.
strengthen_logic.learn_programming: Logic as executable instructions. Debug = find logical errors.
strengthen_logic.play_chess: Strategic sequential thinking. If I move here, then...
strengthen_logic.debate: Construct arguments, identify fallacies, defend positions.
strengthen_logic.solve_puzzles: Sudoku, logic puzzles, riddles require logical deduction.

avoid_pitfalls.analysis_paralysis: Don't get stuck in endless logical analysis. Decide and act.
avoid_pitfalls.emotional_bypass: Don't use logic to avoid feeling. Integrate, don't suppress.
avoid_pitfalls.rigidity: Logic is tool, not identity. Be flexible when situation requires.
avoid_pitfalls.ivory_tower: Ground logic in reality. Don't get lost in abstractions.
avoid_pitfalls.argument_as_war: Logic to discover truth, not defeat opponent.

integration.with_ethics: Ask: Is this logical conclusion also good/right?
integration.with_sensorics: Check: Does logical model match physical reality?
integration.with_intuition: Use logic to verify intuitive insights, but trust intuition to generate new ideas.

rationalism.claim: Reason (logic) is primary source of knowledge
rationalism.method: Derive truths from self-evident axioms via deduction

logicism.attempt: Derive all math from logical axioms + set theory
logicism.outcome: Partial success. Gödel showed limits. But deep connection between logic and math.

logical_positivism.claim: Meaningful statements = either empirically verifiable or logically true (tautologies)
logical_positivism.criticism: Self-refuting (own criterion not verifiable). Too restrictive.
logical_positivism.legacy: Influenced analytic philosophy, science, but largely abandoned.

constructivism.claim: Mathematical objects exist only if constructible
constructivism.logic: Rejects law of excluded middle (P or ¬P) for unproven statements

fractal_structure.self_similarity: Logic at all scales: neuron firing (0/1) → sentence → proof → scientific theory
fractal_structure.recursion: Logical systems can reason about themselves (metalogic, proof theory)
fractal_structure.emergence: Complex logical structures emerge from simple rules (axioms → theorems)
fractal_structure.composition: Logical propositions compose into arguments, arguments into theories, theories into paradigms

relationship_to_cfo.cycle: Logic = second step: point (0D idea) → line (1D sequence)
relationship_to_cfo.necessity: Cannot build coherent system without logical structure
relationship_to_cfo.limits: Logic alone insufficient. Need 2D (ethics), 3D (sensorics), 5D (intuition) for complete understanding.
relationship_to_cfo.sacred_truth: Logic is sacred when it reveals structure. Logic is false when it denies higher dimensions (ethics, beauty, consciousness).

warnings: Logic is necessary but not sufficient for human flourishing
info: First of four fundamental cognitive functions
1D fire element matches socionics T function

external.citation: Gödel, K. (1931). On Formally Undecidable Propositions
Russell, B. & Whitehead, A. (1910). Principia Mathematica

meta.archetype: The Analyst, The Systematizer, The Reasoner
meta.integration_path: Logic finds its heart through ethics, its ground through sensorics, its wings through intuition
